page.title: 06EDUCATION
page.content: THE AREA HAS SEVERAL PRIMARY SCHOOLS. AT 11 THE CHILDREN ARE ASSESSED AS TO THEIR SUITABILITY FOR EDUCATION AT A SELECTIVE SCHOOL IN CANTERBURY OR IN OTHER NEIGHBOURING TOWNS. CHILDREN WHO ARE NOT SELECTED ATTEND THE HERNE BAY SECONDARY SCHOOL AT GREENHILL. THE OLDEST SCHOOL IN THE AREA IS THE PRIMARY SCHOOL AT HERNE WHICH WAS {OPENED ON APRIL 29TH 1867.}THERE WERE THEN 2 CLASSROOMS AND THE HEADMASTER'S HOUSE. THERE ARE NOW 13 CLASSROOMS, 5 INFANT AND 8 JUNIOR AND THERE ARE 385 PUPILS. THE SCHOOL HAS GOOD RELATIONS WITH THE CHURCH AND THE CHILDREN ATTEND CHURCH FOR SPECIAL SERVICES. THE NEWEST SCHOOL BEING BRIARY SCHOOL BUILT ON THE SITE OF LOVE STREET FARM AND OPENED IN 1973.THE DEVELOPMENT OF HOUSING ON A LARGE SCALE AND THE DANGER OF TRAFFIC ON THANET WAY LED TO DEMAND FOR A SCHOOL TO SERVE THE AREA.
